newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Yukong expands naphtha cracking capacity.
newsitem.headline: Yukong expands naphtha cracking capacity.

text.p: South Korea's Yukong Ltd said on Tuesday it has expanded the capacity of its second 400,000 tonnes-a-year naphtha cracking centre to 520,000 tonnes a year through de-bottlenecking.
Yukong said in a statement it has invested 100 billion won since November 1995 to renovate and improve its production process to increase capacity.
Yukong announced earlier this year that it would also build a new cracker with an annual cracking capability of 500,000 tonnes by 1999. Its No 1 cracker has an annual capacity of 180,000 tonnes.
